title: What are the four principles people use to justify a decision as ethical? - Quora

response.answer_text: Usually viewed from a health care environment, and sometimes from the legal domain, the four are autonomy (the right to self-choice), beneficence (acting to do no harm), non-maleficence (same coin back side to beneficence-preventing harm to others), and justice (making sure everyone receives fair treatment regardless of many possible factors). In general, ethics lie on a continuum from deontological (virtue) to teleological (ends justify the means). In the contemporary world, it is virtually impossible to characterize any act from either extreme…
